titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia publications and printed materials 1857-2005
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia publications and printed materials

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of printed materials of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Materials include: meeting announcements (1848-1981); posters for lectures and notices and invitations for other College programs and events (1885-1981); copies of the Historical Collection's newsletter Fugitive Leaves (1935-1969, 1995-1996); and copies of the Fellows' Forum newsletter (1995-1998). The collection also includes circular letters; catalogues and collection guides; exhibit and educational brochures; College by-laws and constitutions; staff manuals, governance guidelines, and staff directories; and reports, addresses, and reprints of articles.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
